meanings.definition: The study of the physical and social aspects of cities.
meanings.sent1: Urbanism involves examining how cities are built and how people live in them.
meanings.sent2: Architects and sociologists often focus on urbanism to understand city life better.
meanings.sent3: Studying urbanism can reveal fascinating insights into city structures and community dynamics.
meanings.sent4: The intricate web of urbanism unravels the secrets of city planning and social interactions.
meanings.sent5: Exploring urbanism is like peeling back the layers of a bustling city to reveal its inner workings.

meanings.definition: The way in which cities are planned and developed.
meanings.sent1: Urbanism plays a crucial role in shaping the layout and growth of cities.
meanings.sent2: City officials often consult urbanism principles when designing new neighborhoods.
meanings.sent3: Sometimes, urbanism can lead to unexpected city transformations that surprise residents.
meanings.sent4: The art of urbanism is akin to crafting a beautiful tapestry of buildings and streets.
meanings.sent5: The magic of urbanism lies in turning urban landscapes into vibrant, livable spaces.

meanings.sent1: Urbanism captures the essence of city living and its unique features.
meanings.sent2: Residents of bustling cities experience the fast-paced urbanism every day.
meanings.sent3: In the world of urbanism, even the smallest details can shape city culture.
meanings.sent4: The heartbeat of urbanism pulses through the crowded streets and lively neighborhoods.
meanings.sent5: The tapestry of urbanism weaves together diverse cultures and lifestyles in a city.
